Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jean Ann S
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is very quiet, great for sleeping, large windows with balcony, perfect for Paris. Location near the Arc de Trioumphe is convenient for getting to and from the airport on the Air France bus. Staff all bi-lingual, friendy and helpful. Breakfast was included in our package and I would rate it as fair. We had an upgraded room with a king bed, and the facility was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Mon, you are mine.”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this property probably about 7 or 8 times since their opening, I can fully recommend your next Paris visit to be at this uniquely charming hotel. The rooms are comfortable. Great amenities in each room, tremendous beds, available I-Pad uses for 13$ a day (I-Pad and 3G internet connection incl), I-Pod station, kettle and nespresso machine. In it's first year of opening, prices were much more reasonable; as of late, the price increases seem to be a little much but the quality of rooms & service still makes it one of the best values in this part of Paris.   The off-putting things about this property are that room service comes from the in-house restaurant and a next door's one. However the breakfast is great if you enjoy healthy food and fresh products.   The property sits next to L’Etoile Nightclub which is known for their nice parties with wellknown DJ’s all week long. 5 min away from the hotel, I also recommend the excellent 3 stars restaurant Guy Savoy: try the “Soup d’artichaud a la truffe noire”, an experience you will never ever forget.   Since it's opening the hotel has done an excellent job in keeping it's cleanliness; increasing their amenities and level of service at every guest demand.   Overall, the best times to truly enjoy this property is on the weekend day nights when the hotel is not full; walking through the dark coridors provides a plush but eerie feeling of being transported to a different time and place where you'll be more than satisfied that you have this place to yourself for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nope nope nope”
Reviews.Author: Joanna B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September after purchasing an offer through JetSetter for a two night stay. By no means was the sale rate cheap ($180 a night), but it was an amount I was willing to "splurge" on for a couple of nights in a more luxurious hotel. Anyway, my friend and I arrive, we check in, everything looks nice, they tell us "breakfast is served until ___ through that doorway." Cool. The next day we went down for breakfast, not a large selection but it was free, so we ate a couple of hardboiled eggs and nutella sandwiches. That evening we chatted with a couple also staying there that informed us that they hadn't known the breakfast was 20 euros a day. We hoped that perhaps our first night had come with free breakfast—but no, we go charged 40 euros. Moreover, had we not heard from our friends about this issue, we may have ended up eating there twice and been charged 80 euros for a breakfast that was worth maybe $4. I was upset because I felt as though we had been misled, when I told the receptionist the day of our departure about the predicament (that we were led to believe it was free) he showed no sympathy at all and said "with the gilt offer no... no breakfast included." First of all, this made me feel as though we were being treated as "secondary" guests because we booked the hotel through an offer. Secondly, the memory of being conned out of 20 euros when I could have had a lavish brunch or dinner elsewhere really stains my memory of the Mon Hotel, didn't they realize this means I would never go back or refer my friends to it? Perhaps they figured we were unlikely to return because we used a deal site. Otherwise, the room was nice but small, the hallways were seriously creepy—painted all black, they always made me feel like I was in a murder movie. The location, while close to the Arc de Triumpf and champs de elysee wasn't that great because it was a strange combination of touristy and desolate (on the other side of the arc de triumpf near a bunch of motorcycle shops). I would have much preferred a hotel in a quainter area.

Reviews.Title: “Too Small”
Reviews.Author: ladyluck168
Reviews.Content: The room is new and modern.The bed is comfortable.The lady staff at the front dest was helpful. We had booked a premium room but on arrival found it to be very small,compact and hot With two large suitcase and two cabin baggage,It makes us VERY DIFFICULT to move around in with 2 people. With 4 star rating and rate above 100Euros,I expect more.At least proper wardrobe with standard size.Not a small wardrobe covered by curtains.It would also be nice if they could provide tea making facility. I used to stay in different hotels in Paris.All located in the heart of tourist spot and shopping.I paid about 90 and 100 Euros a night.One of the hotel has smaller escalator compared to Mon.But rooms are MORE spacious and more comfortable. I learned about something.I realized i didn't actually need modern new room with good lighting.It always look better in pictures than in real life.My next visit,i will book standard Parisian room.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by our -in need of a refurb- room”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Paris for a romantic birthday/valentines break in 2011 and we stayed at Mon Hotel for 4 nights. While the location was great, staff very friendly and lobby and bar chic, unfortunately our "deluxe" room left a little to be desired. The hotel positions itself as a four star boutique, but our room on the very top floor of the hotel had paint peeling from the doors with damp/mould in the ensuite bathroom. I would get on with this if we had chosen to stay in more budget concious accomdation,but given my experience in other 4 star hotels along with the rates this hotel commands we were disappointed to have to raise our issues with the reception. Unfortunately this has put me off staying at Mon Hotel again, as I believe a higher standard can be found for a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Bluelines
Reviews.Content: Mon Hotel is a small boutique hotel next to the Argentine underground station and a short walk from the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Élysées. The hotel has a very stylish interior, with dark and warm colors. There is a small gym and sauna in the basement too. I enjoyed the stay very much and will definitely be back next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, staying here next time again and again”
Reviews.Author: Crissy10001
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by the room size, decor was chic and modern, dark red hues and dark wood floors, got a great deal on jetsetter on the room and given the location next to the Arc, the service, the amazing tub and rain shower, the super comfy bed...can't imagine staying anywhere else unless I got upgraded to the ritz for free. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: plusfour
Reviews.Content: OK, I admit it - I'm not a big fan of Paris. It's probably my own fault because I don't speak the French or know the city very well, but when I was asked to arrange my own hotels for a 3-day business trip to Paris I wasn't entirely optimistic - I had no idea where was a good place to say and the 2 worst hotel experiences I've ever had were both in Paris. Hmm. So after some research, I booked Mon Hotel - reviews and the website looked good, but for €130/night, honestly, I didn't hold out a lot of hope. But, happily, I was quite wrong... On arrival, the location was great. 2 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and 5 minutes from Champs Elysee. OK, it was a 45-minute, €50 cab ride from Gare du Nord (I arrived on Eurostar from London), but hey, this is Paris traffic we're talking about... Check-in was great too - a low-lit lobby with appropriately cool furnishing started things off well and superb service and a friendly feeling from the start completed the picture nicely - they even correctly guessed who I was. Getting into my room didn't disappoint either. I was in a Superior and it was excellent - cool decor (B&W photos on the grey suede walls - nice), an Eames chair (reproduction, presumably) at the desk, a very clean, big comfy bed, Loewe TV, JBL iPod dock and a funky, clean, big bathroom complete with fluffy bathrobes and slippers behind the door. It was relatively small, but this is how hotel rooms in Paris are - perfectly reasonable though in terms of size (better than I expected), and even space for my suitcase (a rarity in cities that have small hotel rooms). Free WiFi too. All good. Outside the room, things were equally superb - the bar was cool, vibey and served great drinks with good, friendly service. Bossanova versions of 80's hits as the background music? Yes please. From start to finish, the service here was excellent - the small (numbers, not size!) staff gave the attention and quality of service that really makes a boutique hotel stand out from a nicely decorated hotel, with everything from helping book cars and cabs to offering advice on where to go being done with a touch that made me feel they actually cared. In my experience, this is rare - and good. I have only 3 minor-ish negatives: first, the AC in my room was a challenge - I never managed to get it below hot; second, breakfast was good but expensive (€22), but again - it's Paris; and third, despite leaving the 'do not disturb' sign on my door when I left the first day, I got back and my room had been serviced. Not the end of the world, but worth knowing... A final note regarding location - if you want the dead centre of Paris tourist spots, maybe this isn't ideal (it's kind of on the edge of the busy stuff). But it's 5-minutes walk from the Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe and in an extremely pleasant, quiet street. Personally, exactly what I want - close enough, but not in the middle of it all. And to get to CDG airport was easy - 30 minutes and €60 (leaving at 5:30am). Overall, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again when I have to come back to Paris. This is a very, very good hotel at a reasonable price somewhere it's easy to book a very, very bad hotel at a high price. Area, rooms, service, vibe, price - all excellent. Don't be fooled by it's low ranking on TripAdvisor - it's fantastic. Strangely, I'm starting to like Paris...

Reviews.Title: “5 star Executive room in a 4 star hip boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: OreoBoy
Reviews.Content: The Executive room is simply amazing. It is so large by Paris standard with luxurious amenities. Huge king bed, separate tub and shower and 2 basins! I would also like to compliment the front desk team for the amazing and friendly services especially to the young man named Alexandre. The location is also great, convenient walk from the airport drop-off air france bus. I enjoyed my 3 nights stay in Mon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personable, intimate boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: wor7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room for 10 days. After reading the reviews we were concerned about the rooms size, as we were staying for a few days, but even when our room was on the small side it was fine. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful, specially Cecilia, she was great!!! The location is excellent. The hotel is in a very quiet street (extremely quiet at night) two blocks from the metro line 1 (which takes you to some of the major museums and interesting areas) and a few blocks from the Arc de Triomphe, where you can choose from 4 different metro lines. I won't give a long description of the room/bathroom decor because everything looks as nice as it does in the hotel's website, so if you like what you see there, you won't be dissapointed. My only criticism about the room is that the air conditioning in October was only heat and even when we turned it off, the room was hot. We had to open the window, sometimes even to sleep. Other than that everything was great! This is the place for you, if you enjoy the intimate, personable, small boutique hotel feel. I would definitely return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mon Hotel is my hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoyceDel
Reviews.Content: Mon Hotel is a small boutique hotel just two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe. The location was perfect. Two blocks to catch the tour bus, two blocks to great restaraunts, perfect. Large black and white photos of Marylin Monroe decorate the lobby and restaurant/bar. The rooms are very chic with small balconies, big bathrooms, and a lot of amenities. The staff was very courteous (scramblling at the last minute to get us a taxi to the airport on time). Leave your luggage for the staff to get to your room. The elevator is the smallest I have ever seen. I'm thinking a motorized "dumb waiter". Two people max. We will definitely stay there on our return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Arc de Triomphe Location, Great Service, Small Room..”
Reviews.Author: mikemcd
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this stylish (Marilyn Monroe themed) boutique hotel for 2 nights. I had a room on the top floor overlooking the cute neighborhood roofs with a little 1 chair/1 table balcony. The hotel is located down a quiet street just off the Ave de la Grand Armée, and a 5 minute walk to the Arc de Triomphe (top of the Champs Elysees), so easy access to the city. The service at the front desk was amazing!!! The staff here were exceptionally friendly and helpful, and spoke good English. The rooms were a bit small though (tiny tub/shower) as TA reviewers have noted. But for 1 person it was fine. The hotel also had free wireless internet throughout, which was convenient. Also my bed was very comfortable. The only negative was the service in the restaurant/bar. It felt like the Paris you read about (but that I didn't experience anywhere else during my trip). The rest of the staff was excellent though. All in all it was a terrific stay at the Mon, and I will recommend to friends, and return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, super customer service!”
Reviews.Author: rndiver1
Reviews.Content: Quietly located side street very near to the Arch de Triumph. Close to restaurants, shopping, and public transportation. The front desk employees were very attentive, helpful with any inquiries, including finding a dentist on the first evening in Paris at 7:30p.m. The room is average size, modern design, with refrigerator and coffee pot. The coffee pods are not free however. It had a small patio and sweet table and chairs for morning coffee in your room. WiFi is free. Nice bathroom with hairdryer and toiletry items included. The room was clean, and the matteress was comfortable, however the bed did tilt downward at the head. We did not try the gym, resteraunt or bar. I can not say enough about the wonderful service provided by all staff. They are very eager to make your stay perfect. They are very nice about holding your luggage while your touring on the last day. They even offered to put flowers I purchased in a vase to keep them fresh while we toured the city. My only complaint is the map that I was provided before departing the U.S. did not show the street name's location. The taxi drivers also found it difficult to locate. It was actually very easy to find with the map the hotel provided once we arrived. My advise is to google it before you go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: HelgaP17
Reviews.Content: Paid £160 for two that included breakfast and boat trip this was on special on line. Hotel in a great possition 5 mins from Arc De Triomphe the hotel room was small but that was not 2 much of a problem as it took our breath away with the decor through out the hotel. The continental breakfast was delicious just what you needed before a day out sight-seeing. Would recomend this hotel and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for adults with superb service.”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetennisi
Reviews.Content: Both our rooms were clean, nicely furnished but very small. Fortunately there were no stairs to climb with our luggage, unlike the rest of Europe. The front reception people were outstanding. When they weren't familiar with something like transportation (bus, rail or taxi) they got the answer in short order. They found a more reasonable taxi service for 3 with luggage to the rail station. My husband's camera battery did not work, they found a store to get a replacement. They offered a front desk computer when we needed to check on something on our itinerary. It was a very good experience for my husband and adult son and me. Convenient to the Arch, rail station and buses. We did enjoy our 3-4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it & would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: owenandprincess
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mon Hotel while visiting Paris for our anniversary, and were very pleased with our room, the services provided by the hotel, and the quality of the staff. The breakfast in the morning was always delightful with a nice assortment of healthy items to choose from. Cecile at the front desk helped us by recommending sites and restaurants for us to visit, and helped us figure out the best train routes to get to each destination. The rooms are small, as everyone has suggested, but for just the 2 of us, it was intimate, cozy and perfect. The hotel was very clean, with a nice ambience, and we would stay there again in a heartbeat! Also a great location, with many sites right within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Paris: Wonderful room! Excellent service! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LucBR
Reviews.Content: We have been there for a romantic vacation last spring and had the chance to be in one of the best! The room is large, comfortable and charming! People received us very well (special thanks for Cecilia, who helped us suggesting great restaurants, wine shops and the best of Paris; and Brazilians will love it: she speaks Portuguese!). Check the photos I posted here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Quiet Boutique Hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: deny67
Reviews.Content: Desing room not big but enough when you are on business trip Very well located when you work @ La Defense or anywhere in Paris through Subway

Reviews.Title: “cool, dark and sexy”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: Mon Hotel impresses from the moment you walk through the front door. The lobby is cool with its Murano glass chandeliers and the restro bar is dark and sexy. The hotel also includes a turkish bath. We stayed in an Executive Suite and really appreciated its dark bathroom, black and white fashion photos and small terrace overlooking a ‘typical’ Parisian street scene.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale boutique hotel with a distinct party flavour”
Reviews.Author: larserikhovde
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, even though the guide book from 2011 stated that there would be a DJ spinning tracks on the weekends in the lobby. That was abolished a year ago, and was disappointing! The rooms are quite small. The difference between the two smallest categories were impossible to identify, yet the rooms are nicely furnished, kind of sexy, and with flat screens and iPod dock speakers. Very cool! At Mon we could behave as we wanted. Back home at 6AM from clubbing, an afterparty was no problem and the room service taking care of our hangovers was impeccable, even though I missed club sandwich on the menu. Great location and very close to one of the hippest places in Paris at night, L'arc. The service and friendlyness of the staff was surprisingly good, to be Paris. Honest smiles, extra service in terms of booking ticksets for museums and carrying luggage for us. Very nice! Definitely coming back to Mon Hotel. Perhaps not recommending this place to my parents, as the party factor is quite high on the weekends I assume, though definitely a cool place to have stayed. I wish it had a DJ though!! To me the place seemed quite dead in the afternoons.... Thanks for having us!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: Kate_rochester
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while in Paris this week and had the greatest time. This place is just adorable. The decor is great, it's small and beautiful and completely charming. We got an executive room (suite?) and I will say that it was still just a touch small but that's to be expected in Paris. The view from the room was gorgeous, the soaking tub and shower were great, and the overall style is just awesome. The staff at the hotel is unbelievably nice and they were helpful throughout our stay. The only caveat is that there isn't a ton to do in this area at night so you'll need to take the metro but that's easy enough. I would absolutely send any of my friends to stay here, we just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: johnirusta
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by saying I hate Paris. I hate almost everything about that vapid city. Unfortunately, I work in TV so that necessitates travel to Paris several times a year. Double unfortunately, we mostly have to stay in the right bank. That being said, the Mon makes all those things more than bearable. First off the rooms are perfect if you don't have to spend all your days in but for Paris, the space in their Superior is okay for 2 - 3 nights' stay, bathrooms are old fashioned but nice and the room has a super comfortable bed with awesome sheets. The hotel itself is trendy and super designy but not in an obnoxious way. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful making us feel right at home. We normally stay at the K... few streets away and while the rooms are nice there, the hotel as a whole is so sceney and obnoxious that every time you walk in the door you have to show your key and the doormen look you up and down. Not so at Mon. It's just a super cool, low key (for now) place to call home when you are in Paris. The food at MonBar's is awesome too. While the drinks are expensive, they are delicious. I highly recommend their Bellini. I miss it. We also managed to get a corporate rate, which I hope will not change much for our future travels. Are there some glitches...yes...the coridors aren't dark (as some other reviewers have mentioned) it's just that there is a huge contrast between coridors and rooms which are particulary enlightened. The first night we were there the club next door was pretty loud. Luckily, the noise stopped at around midnight and our jetlag lulled us to sleep. There's no doubt in my mind (if the rates stay the same) this will be the only place I rest my weary head when I am reluctantly dragged in to the city of fashion.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice - Return would depend on rates”
Reviews.Author: Ridgesas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as our last stop in a trip around the world. Chose this hotel based on location, rate and reviews on this site. Great location a stones throw from the Arc and very easy to get to from the airport via the Air France bus which stops at the Arc. Walked to everything including the Musee the Orsay, Eiffel Tower, Seine and RER station. Also took a day trip to Versailles which was very easy via RER station. Room was small as expected but very comfortable and clean. Service was great and the entire staff was friendly and informative. Staff provided great restaurant recommendations but the best was La Villa which is a great new restaurant a 5 minute walk away. We would consider returning on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by late night noise.”
Reviews.Author: MarathonMan068
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mon last week as the location was perfect for the Paris marathon being a short walk from both the start and finish lines. Apart from the convenience for the marathon the location is excellent and could hardly be more central with a metro station nearby and down a quiet side street with minimal traffic. The rooms are small but I think you have to expect this with such a central location and I understand that this is not unusual for Paris. Our room had an iPOD dock (more of those later) but lacked tea or coffee making facilities which would have been nice. Staff were all very friendly and mostly very helpful. The problem we had here was that we had noisy guests in the next room and the sound insulation between rooms is poor. The first night that there was a problem we could hear various conversations in raised voices and shrieking late into the night. We let that go until music started playing at 1am, presumably on the iPOD dock. A phone call to reception prompted a visit to the room and a request for them to be quiet and I was reasonably happy with this response. The next morning I enquired if the same people would be in that room that night and if they were if we could be moved. I was told they would be there but that they would be spoken to and the situation would be dealt with. Unfortunately I left the matter at that. One quiet night was had but then on the next night there was again shouting and music which started at about 6am. Again I phoned reception to complain. This time however they phoned the room rather than visit and the noise continued. I phoned reception again. The noise continued. Yet again I phone reception and the receptionist informed me that our neighbours were not answering their phone. I had to insist that he personally visit, which he did 20 minutes or so later after a further phone call. The next day I asked to see the manager who was very understanding and offered to cancel the costs of the breakfasts as a goodwill gesture. Given that the breakfasts are outrageously overpriced at 22 Euros per head per day for a cold buffet this was welcome but somehow didn't seem to address the issue and left me unsatisfied as well as tired. This is basically a nice hotel but the prime purpose of a hotel is to allow it's guests to have an uninterrupted restful nights sleep. Hotel Mon unfortunately failed in this regard and their response to the problem that developed was inadequate. If you are a light sleeper or particularly bothered by the noise of others I would think carefully before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful friendly staff, great location, comfortable beds, pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: andiamoTD
Reviews.Content: The staff was outstandingly helpful. We asked about Seine boat tours, best shopping areas and shows to see - they took care of everything (Cecilia was amazing!). The location was great as its just a block away from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees is on the other side of the Arc. The metro stop is hardly a full block away and I felt the location was superb overall. The rooms were small as is to be expected in Europe and we fit two of us comfortably. The rooms and beds were comfortable and a good nights sleep was had by all. We stayed on the third floor and the elevator was quick! Thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I would absolutly recomend this hotel to others as it exceeded my expectations. I read alot of the reviews here on tripadvisor before I decided to stay at this hotel vs. others and I am very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Quiet Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pposte
Reviews.Content: So, found this hotel on www.belle-epoque.com Neat website that finds boutique hotels all over Europe. The hotel is on Champs Elysee, but on the opposite side of the Arc. So being, restaurant options are very few, but the Metro stop is on the corner and you can easily get all over Paris from here. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. They recommended some very good restaurants and even helped with reservations, directions and all. The hotel's gem is the bar with the lovely Florence serving up drinks. She was wonderful to talk to and gave a very interesting perspective of Paris from a Parisiens point of view. Several warnings...the rooms pictured on the website deceiving. The two lower level category rooms are quite small. We ended up upgrading to the largest room they had, which is beautiful but also comes at a cost. Speaking of costs, make sure you double check your bill. On check-out we were billed for laundry that was not ours and we were charged us for breakfast every day, which we did not have. All in all, it was a pleasant stay, but next time I will try another place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente Hotel in PARIS”
Reviews.Author: camims
Reviews.Content: I live in New York and travel a lot in Europe . I came with my husband in January for a "Good Time big W.E. in Paris" and we definitlly had one of our best stays in this Hotel in Paris. I highly recommend it. Pretty place to stay with a nice decoration. Very Central, quiet and clean. The staff was adorable and very professional. You will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fail In love”
Reviews.Author: Megsisk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Mon hotel for are honeymoon. We had the best time the hotel and room was so nice and the bed was so comfy. The staff was so helpful from recommending restaurants to making dinner reservation at the Eiffel tower. The location was great it was so easy to get on the metro and get some where in 15 min. We loved that is was off a busy street so there where no noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had an enjoyable stay here in exec room on 5th floor. Minimal traffic noise. Reception staff were outstanding and really made our stay enjoyable. Coped well with our somewhat ambitious requests for restaurant bookings. Room was good size for Paris and kept well by housekeeper. Metro is convenient. Decent gym and sauna. A real boutique hotel feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Comfortable Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: Aucadog
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Mon Hotel, arriving just after Christmas for four nights. I felt as though I were staying in someone's home rather than a hotel. I had the Executive Room, the largest offered, and thoroughly enjoyed it. I have stayed in much smaller rooms in Paris. The furnishings are modern and minimalist. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was large with a separate tub and shower. The tub came in handy each night as I relaxed after walking the streets of Paris all day! Some reviews mention the garbage trucks that come by early in the morning. This was noticeable but not troublesome. I either used it as an alarm clock or quickly fell back to sleep. Other reviews mention the small elevator and the dark spiral staircase. I was on the first floor (second floor to us Americans) and only used the elevator when I was checking out. It was small but typical for older buildings. Normally I took the stairs and, yes, they are rather dark. The location of the hotel is great. I actually grew to like it more each day. Within a 2 minute walk to the Argentine Metro it was easy to use the subway. Coming back to the hotel in the evening I would be welcomed into a quiet safe neighborhood that seemed far away from the Champs Elysee that is literally just minutes away by foot. I only used the restaurant/bar one night for a champagne and dessert. Try the Molten Chocolate Cake. Tres Bon! I didn't use many of the hotel services (fitness room, spa, etc) as I was out and about all day but everyone I met was very nice and helpful. I would stay there again. Be sure and visit the areas around Blvd Victor Hugo. There are many nice restaurants that are not typical tourist hangouts. Good food and shopping along the way too.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Moglet6
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location but we arrived on the Sunday and there was no restaurant available for Sunday or Monday, the room was a deluxe but quite compact. There was also no room service and no tea/coffee facilities in the room although there was a mini bar. The sealant in the bathroom had seen better days and was quite stained although the bathroom toiletries were lovely. Good choice for breakfast but at breakfast on our second morning, one of the waiters appreared to be being told off by ? the boss or a manager in front of breakfast guests. The telling off went on for some considerable time and then the two waiters spent the rest of the time discussing what had happened. We felt quite uncomfortable with it all although we did not hear what was being said - it was just a bad atmosphere. Didn't like all the black decor on the walls - very difficult to see particuarly coming down the steep spiral staircase. Was looking forward to it but quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lorainepalmier
Reviews.Content: I chose the executive room, which is supposed to be the biggest one for more 600 € and it was so small that we didn't know where to put our stuff. Quite disappointing. The hotel is getting old, would need a Restoration. Plus there were dust on each furniture in the room. definitely not an hot spot in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull weekend in the center of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Auredum
Reviews.Content: We spent a great week-end in Paris with my wife in this charming boutique hotel. Great location close to Champs Elysees and Arc de Triomphe. My wife loved the deco, modern and trendy, and the Spa (small but very nice). Beds are very comfortable, rooms are well equipped (i-pod station, nespresso, bathrobe, slippers, minibar, flat screen TV with International channel...) even if bathroom amenities could be better. Staff is friendly and helpful. Did not had the chance to taste the restaurant but breakfast was fine. My advice is to go for the Executive room for the size and the in-room bathroom, a real plus. We planned to go back to Paris in Mon Hotel soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was very nice and staff was friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Angie6622
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to the Arc de Triumphe and was very clean. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris service at its worst”
Reviews.Author: pmstraveller
Reviews.Content: the hotel is funky designer breed of hotels in Paris. great design concept in the public area funky pop art and good taste. But the deluxe room was small and I mean small. The side table on one side of the bed was a mini bar fridge, there was no room for a full suitcase and the cupboard was a small hole in the wall hidden by a curtain. I understand hotel revenue is based on number of rooms but if you are going into the luxury market offer some space. The worst was one member of staff who was and ought not to be employed by any hotel front desk. Lazy rude and the worst in the industry. Service at breakfast was good but the arrogance of the night front office manager left such a bad taste, that I could not recommend this hotel to any person.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of + and Lots of -”
Reviews.Author: FayeCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impossible to rate as there were things we really liked and things that we didn’t: Good things: - The staff were extremely friendly, tried to be helpful, and spoke excellent English - The bed was very large and comfortable - The bedding was nice and the pillows were great - The rate was reasonable - There is very little street noise (apart from the morning garbage pick-up) Bad things: - They play awful music in the lobby which would have been okay except for the speaker in the hall on our floor - we could hear the music in our room. When we complained the staff were quick to turn it down but we had to complain every day (and we were there for several days). Why they would play music so close to the rooms is a mystery and why they couldn’t disconnect the speaker on our floor was another mystery. Some nights the music was turned off after about 10pm but on many it ran well into the wee hours (hearing it at 2am was really annoying but it was also annoying during the afternoon when one wanted a quick nap as it prevented a good sleep). It also plays in the restaurant but here too when we complained it was turned down quickly. I don’t think guests should have to complain about the same thing repeatedly – when staff know that there is a problem it should be given a more permanent fix. - The room and bathroom were tiny but we expected that – this is Paris after all. However, there should be storage. The closet was extremely tiny and there wasn’t a single drawer in the room. In spite of being very limited on space, we had to leave one suitcase out to hold things that should have been in drawers. - Breakfast is in addition to the room rate at a charge of 19 Euros per person. That seems to be very high. We walked up the Avenue to a little place called Bert’s where we could get coffee, a pastry and a large fresh juice for 5.70 Euros. Other things: - Bring your own slippers if your feet are any bigger than a lady’s size 8 - Bring all of your own soaps, etc. as what is provided is highly scented - It would be great if the spiral staircase had better lighting – the black décor is okay but not when it makes it hard to navigate the stairs - Be prepared to spend a lot of time on the Metro. The hotel is close to the Argentine Metro and the trains are very frequent and easy to use. But given the location of the hotel we found we spent a lot of time on the Metro getting to the main sites. This is the trade-off for the reasonable hotel room rate (for a 4 star). Given all of this, please ignore my numerical ratings – I had to pick average to balance out the good and the bad. If you don’t mind the negatives noted above, the comfort of this place and the staff make it one to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Love with Mon hotel”
Reviews.Author: liamer31
Reviews.Content: I had a great time in Mon Hotel – the design is chic and cosy the staff takes good care of you! I had a Deluxe room on the 5th floor with a king size bed, a nespresso (necessary when you don’t have time for breakfast) and a nice balcony! The bed was very comfortable (I hate hotels with uncomfortable beds!) and the area is very calm. The location was perfect as I had a meeting in Neuilly! I first came for business, but I decided to extend my stay for the week end with my wife for our 15th anniversary. The reception and concierge have been very kind – they booked (and changed!) all our restaurant reservations, taxis, transferts for the airport and so. I definitely recommend this hotel and I will come back for my next business trips!

Reviews.Title: “overdue a refurb”
Reviews.Author: auserLondon
Reviews.Content: Overdue a refurb. Internet didn't work properly Bathroom fixtures have seen better days - they've tried to patch up the bathroom - but fixtures are stained and cleanliness is so so. Room is dark / poorly lit - I couldn't wait to leave. Really not worth the €400 or so they charge for a room

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: goajames
Reviews.Content: I stayed a night here in July with my wife and small baby and we absolutely loved it. We are used to the small rooms in Paris - so we were more than happy with our executive room. Great amenities - loved the in room espresso, the view of Av Foch, and the breakfast was excellent. The location is this place's best asset - you really couldn't ask for a better spot for the price. I totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chic boutique hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TravelGav
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel after searching on Tripadvisor for a small hotel in a particular area that wasn’t chintzy and MonHotel seemed to fit the bill. We couldn’t have been happier with the choice. From the moment we arrived - in fact from the email we received prior to arrival - to check out, the staff were fantastic. It was the sort of personal service that I’ve only encountered in well-known 5* hotels before. We sat at the reception desk while check in took place then we were asked about our plans and given lots of info about travelling round and how to get to places. The receptionist even looked up the weather forecast unprompted on the internet. It was also a nice touch that she didn’t once try to speak to us in English even though our French is quite rusty and all the staff speak fluent English. Our luggage was also taken up to our room while we were checking in. The public areas are quite dramatic – walls in black or purple with low lighting, chandeliers and flowers. It was quite reminiscent of a Malmaison hotel. The corridor on each floor is a different colour – ours was red, which matched the red padded leather lining of the lifts. Note - the passenger lift by reception is tiny (2 persons with no luggage) but there is a second one round the corner. Our room was on the 5th floor with the benefit of a walk-out balcony overlooking buildings opposite. Light and airy but without doubt small, the room was decorated in a modern style with suede wallcoverings and a marble bathroom, all in neutral colours. The aircon was efficient and silent and the bed very comfortable with a memory foam mattress. The only downside was the showerhead which was hopeless and sprayed water in every direction which was a shame as the water pressure was good. Toiletries (Compagnie de Provence), slippers, robes were the amenities in the bathroom. Breakfast in the black/purple restaurant was a simple affair again with very friendly staff. The food / drink was of good quality but maybe pricy if not already included in the room rate. Nearest metro only 2 mins’ walk away – the hotel is in a safe, residential area, but the Arc de Triomphe is only 5 mins on foot. I wouldn’t hesitate to return to MonHotel and given the level of service we experienced, I am surprised that it’s not higher in the Tripadvisor rankings. I would like to thank the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “What a great, friendly, chic Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: mkzarsky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 25th wedding anniversary this month in Paris. Largely based upon the reviews on this site, we selected Mon Hotel for the trip. It truely exceeded all our expectations. The hotel has a limited number of rooms which makes the experience very personal. It is appointed in a very Paris chic way which makes it both unique and very memorable. It is located near the Arch d Triumph therefore a perfect starting point for a tour of the heart of the city. The staff is amoung the very best we have experienced in our travels. They gladly speak English, and are very helpful...in fact making our anniversary diner reservations in advance over email. The whole experience was outstanding. We give this hotel our very highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, PERFECT SERVICE, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MyTripsWorld
Reviews.Content: I had such a great experience staying at Mon Hotel. I actually felt like home cause all staff treated me in a special way! Thanks to Francis, one of them, who has helped me a looottt!! Have no enough words to say how much i liked staying there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent botique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelerak53
Reviews.Content: very clean 4* which desreves the ranking. very personal feel from check in .hotel about 4 min walk to arc de truimph (handy for air france airport bus) -numerous metro stations within minutes also . plenty of restraunts bars(altough rather expensive) ,also mcdonald . the breakfast was good (altough no cooked english as is norm in continent) rooms were cleaned bedsheets and towels changed daily .bathroom was very clean bathtub as well as shower with toiletries the nice quaint steam room(hamam) in the basement was very wellcome to refresh in evening after long days walks/sightseeing there is also small gym .the only suggestion tea/coffee facilities in room would be welcome --all in all perfect location and perfect hotel --would definatley go again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: toxtethscouser
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a really nice feel to it, hallways and the lift are very 'porn' with dark red lighting which me and my gf found amusing :) The rooms are small but its what i expected from a paris hotel. The rooms wer very nice inside tho, lovely bathroom and a nice comfy bed with flatscreen tv. We didnt spend much time in the hotel anyway because of the amount of places to see in Paris. Breakfast was nice with pastry's cereal etc. Location wise its perfect, near most of the main sites and really close to the main street which has all the main shops. Can I just say how helpful the staff were, especially the one on the sunday who let us use his computer to print our boarding pass's and lent me his universal adapter :) he couldnt do enough to help us both thank you....sorry i didnt get your name. All in all i'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I am lucky that i have been there”
Reviews.Author: ymaraghy
Reviews.Content: I been to Mon Hotel for three days during my visit to Paris. I really enjoyed my stay and the staff are great. At first when i entered the hotel i felt that i made the wrong choice yet once i entered the room and interact with the staff i changed my mind. The rooms are clean and acceptable size (Actually the executive is big one). Bathroom is nice, clean. Staff are great and helpful i missed my keys there and we kept in contact till they send it to me two days after. I really liked the place and staff. The location is perfect 10 minute from Arc De Triumph and Champ Elysee where you can take a metro from there to anywhere in Paris. If you are not used to open showers so go to deluxe room and not executive room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: RLKScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mon for three nights, It is ideally situated for exploring Paris by walking,metro,and bus. It is very comfortable and the staff are exceptional. Must say a special thank you to the staff who on finding that my wife had left her handbag in reception, made arrangements to have the bag taken to the airport and returned to us before our flight . They certainly excell in customer service. THANK YOU. A thank you also to our Paris shuttle service driver who on hearing the situation kept us informed, assisted us with phone calls and continually checked with us until the bag was delivered. He provided a service above and beyond his call of duty. Thank you again. I would recommend Paris shuttle service for transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BAF68
Reviews.Content: Great service! Great quality. Remodeled nicely. VERY small rooms. Location a bit far but accesible for metro entrance to get around. Free WI-FI only at lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best in paris”
Reviews.Author: PartnersnCrime
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Paris six times and stayed in six different hotels. A charming modern boutique beauty. Convenient for both shopping and sight seeing. Best of all Louis vuitton is around the corner. Blew all my money In Paris but loved it. Tony Chew - Vasco delegation The hotel staff were wonderful. Courteous helpful. The manager Francis is a gem. Thankyou for making my stay in Paris with my wife so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, centrally located, but rooms are too small!”
Reviews.Author: Kellysan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mon Hotel for 5 nights. We took the Air France Shuttle Bus which dropped off us on Avenue Carnot near the Arc de Triomphe. From there it was a short 5 minute walk to the hotel. The staff were pleasant and allowed us to check in early. The rooms were nicely decorated, but very small when compared to American size rooms. I've travelled all over Europe and this is the second smallest room I have ever stayed in. The room had a queen size bed and there wasn't enough room to get around the bed on one side. There was no dresser in the room and we couldn't put our clothes away, except for the closet were there were some hangers and a few small shelves. The bathrooms were compact and small and definitely the kind where 1 person is in it a time. The breakfast buffet consisted of breads, pastry's, yogurt, cereal, ham and cheeses. The wait staff were efficient. We had dinner at the restaurant and it wasn't that good and not worth the price. We ordered the steak rare and came out well done and the gnocchi was a little hard. Our package included 60 minute massages which was a great comfort after a long day of walking all over the city. Would we stay here again? Only if we had a bigger room. We had a deluxe room which was too small for a 6' man and 5'2" woman. We kept bumping into each other in the room. Other than that the hotel was nice and the staff were pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “They blew it in the last 30 seconds”
Reviews.Author: Travel09871
Reviews.Content: With regards to location and ambiance, this hotel was terrific. The service was even exceptional for almost the entire time (entire staff spoke english). That being said, I must comment on what happened as I was leaving: We asked for them to call a taxi for us so we could catch the Eurostar, for which we had already purchased tickets. They told us it would arrive in 5-7 minutes, after 30 minutes went by without a cab (we ended up missing the train, obviously not their fault), I went back to the front desk to ask for them to call again. While I was there, another patron was at the desk also calling for a cab. As the first cab arrived both the other guest and I went to get in (I assumed that since I had been waiting nearly 40 minutes at this point that I was entitled to the first cab). This is when the woman from the front desk had the audacity to run outside yelling at me that I must wait and the first cab was for the other guest who had just called! How does that work?! It was the most obnoxious and rude thing that happened to me my entire vacation - I simply couldn't believe that a hotel professional would do that. Out of disdain for that last memory I have, I say out of spite and disgust, please do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel with normal amenities but a GREAT staff”
Reviews.Author: avinciguerra
Reviews.Content: We booked Mon Hotel through a discount travel website and were expecting great things. The best thing about the hotel was its staff. We were there during the volcanic ash crisis and they were extremely helpful in giving us internet access. They spoke great English and assisted us when getting through to the airlines by speaking in French. They were generally wonderful. As for the hotel, the hallways were a little dark and the elevators were extremely small. We found the room to be just fine--it had an ipod dock and a good tv with many English channels. The shower was a little tough to figure out at first and everything else in the room was what I might describe as sterile. Transferring to Mon Hotel from a luxury hotel on Rue Rivoli, I had come to appreciate the turn-down service and other things from the cleaning staff. The only way we noticed the cleaning staff had been in our room for any of the three days we spent there was that the trash cans were empty and we had fresh towels. The location was nice, just about five minutes from the Arc de Triomphe. All in all, I would say that Mon Hotel would be a good choice if you can get it for a good price...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, will stay here again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fagansl
Reviews.Content: Wow! First off the staff is first rate! Any assistance they could give us with dinner reservations, directions, etc, they were very helpful and professional. We stayed in one of the business class rooms and it was perfect. Not a lot of space in the bedroom area, but a huge bathroom and a Nespresso machine in the room. The bed has one of the mattresses that doesn't jostle when your partner moves around, so very restful. No traffic noises at night or in the morning and only a few blocks from the nearest Metro, the Arc and the Champs Elysees. Breakfast is small but very good. Don't skip the chocolate croissants or the Cantal cheese. Best to arrange for breakfast when you book your room, it's much cheaper that way. Planning to return in October and will stay here again. Prices are very reasonable by Paris hotel standards. AAAAA+++++

Reviews.Title: “fantastic find a diamond in the ruff”
Reviews.Author: micknix
Reviews.Content: just back from 2 nights at the mon hotel what a charming unique and quirky little place absolutely brilliant boutique hotel i cannot find fault with this place everything was beyond expectation from the price to the location to the comfort everything is accessible from here the metro 5 min the arc de triomphe 5 mins central paris 15 mins parking 2 mins loved this hotel and will be going back next time we are in paris :-)

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with very unique character”
Reviews.Author: SouthEnglandGazania
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a special occasion and it wasn't the cheapest available so expected some level of quality... which we certainly got. The Mon Hotel prides itself on being a 'boutique' hotel and this theory is proven from the moment you enter - very lush decorative features to a high specification, evident throughout the hotel. Rooms are small but modern and have lots of character. Each one is individually decorated, adding to the unique feel of the hotel. Great location - a stones throw from the Arc d'triumph. Well located for access to public transport and places to eat. Best way to get to the Mon Hotel from the Eurostar station is a taxi, which took 15 minutes in the rush hour and cost the same as it would in the UK. I would especially recommend this hotel if you want to surprise a special someone! You will have no hesitations in booking this hotel and can be assured they will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: Alnoug
Reviews.Content: Great location and amazing staff, close to all the Paris cool spots

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel in the Heart of Paris - Luxurious Chic & affordable”
Reviews.Author: matt_poot
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights Nov 20th to 22nd 2009. This hotel comes with four big stars - and there's a reason why its ranked so highly on the trip advisor (winner 2009) web site. I had such a lovely time there last weekend. I was blown away by the hotel - its interior and design, its helpful lovely staff and its cool, but friendly atmosphere. The rooms were spacious, our TV was a Leowe and there was an ipod doc and speaker that worked perfectly. the bed was firm but very comfortable too with crisp white sheets and lovely Marylin Monroe candid photographs on the wall - adding a touch of chic to the place. The lift was very cool - bright red faux leather interior and a gloss black door. The interior designed mood was David Lynch like with cool black carpet and narrow spot lit stairwell! balanced with a spacious reception that boasted a huge vase of white roses and comfy arm chairs. Great Value for money (best Hotel I have stayed in in Paris, and I HAVE STAYED IN A FEW!) Take yr girlfriend here for the most romantic cool chic impressive time ever - a stones throw from the Arc de Triomphe - Spectacular in everyway. Thanks Mon Hotel - It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ironchef49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mon Hotel twice this September and had a great time. The rooms and baths are very modern and quite trendy, fairly spacious for Paris. Everything was spotlessly clean. The staff was pleasant and helpful. Our packages included breakfasts and vouchers for lunch/dinner---very nice, too. This was a new location in Paris for us---near the Arc de Triomphe, its metro station, and numerous bus routes. Restaurants were plentiful, too. The Air France airport bus stop was a 10 minute walk which was very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and well located”
Reviews.Author: sombochris
Reviews.Content: Arrived late on our first day and ate in the restaurant. A limited menu, more like a snack bar. Bar was cozy however and wine waiter very professional.My wife loved the decor, and it definately has the boutique feel. The rooms are small, the bathroom is a reasonable size and the air conditioning does as its told. Staff were polite, but a bit slow, or maybe I was drinking too fast. Certainly makes you feel like your in Paris. If your into motorbikes there are loads of bike shops a few yards away, which kept me amused while my wife bought shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Very Few Redeeming Qualities- Don't Bother Staying Here”
Reviews.Author: TravelShopGirlVT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights recently. I will keep it simple, and would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Con’s * unfriendly staff- I admit our French was terrible, but those staff that spoke English quite well seemed completely annoyed to be doing so- this is the tourism business people, come on! * There is this extremely overwhelming perfume smell piped in throughout lobby/hallways, its alright for the first 2 minutes, but on the 4th trip to the lobby its kind of gross. * underwhelming breakfast options- its continental * there were 900 channels on TV, and only 1 in English-BBC News (multiple channels in every other language) and NO tv guide. * really small rooms, even smaller hallways and smaller yet elevator * the shower curtain was completely moldy and needed to changed or a liner added- it was revolting * No iron in room * Bed consisted of 2 twin beds, not a king mattress * We had spa credits included in our package- not sure I would call it a "spa" looks more like a dungeon, and the massage was terrible, just felt like someone was rubbing sun block in the form of baby oil on me. Oh and it was for 90 Euros * In room fridge smelled like something died in it * Charged us for tap water and ice at bar * No one helped us with luggage to room Pro’s * hotel is in nice neighborhood, close to 2 metro stops * room clean for most part * the hotel was willing to hold bags all day after we checked out * free wireless internet

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, wish I could say the same about the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: east63rd
Reviews.Content: If there was a king size bed in the room, it would be wall-to-wall bed. This hotel has the smallest room that can be imagined. This is NOT a four star property. This is not an elegant hotel. A spa is advertised; it's not there. Massages can be booked in the dingy basement a day in advance. That being said, the staff could not have been nicer. A hip and happening restaurant is part of the property

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel close enough to the Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: PGC94102
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel on a very little street just off the Rue de Grande Armee, which is the main road on the other side of the L'Arc de Triomphe from the Champs Elysees. It's two short blocks from the Metro station, and a couple of minutes walking to the Champs Elysees. It's a bit quieter than some of the hotels on the busier streets but still very convenient. The staff was always extremely courteous and helpful. The place has been updated with nice bathrooms, but it's still rather tight everywhere because it's an old building. We stayed in the smallest room but it was sufficient and the pricing very reasonable. For a good deal, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Real gem.Wonderful staff, great location the 5 ster reviews were right”
Reviews.Author: Robbreg
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Mon hotel and thoroughly enjoy our stay. The place is a bit funky, and the room was pretty small (not unusual in Europe) but the staff was so helpful, telling about great places to eat, etc. We had a most wonder side by side massage that was out of this world! Unfortunately, the restuarant was closed while we were there, but they served a lovely Continental breakfast every morning.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect romantic getaway that was so much more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: trippyanna
Reviews.Content: A really funky and unusual hotel. Everything was to the highest standard, the staff were super, friendly and helpful. We arrived late at night but that made no difference, everything was ready and there was no delay or need to queue. Loved the retro lift and unusual decor which really made it stand out as an individual place rather than just the usual variation on a travelodge that so many places seem to be. Conceirge was very helpful in assisting us with local info, advice and help with local transport. All in all it was a fantastic hotel. Our room was a touch on the small side- this didn't matter for the three nights that we were there but I think that had we stayed a week or more this may have become more of an issue. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “DONT NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL - FRAUDELNT ACTIVITY”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior12317
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - nice hotel, good location but after I checked out, I received a email to say that the hotel was charging me Euro 300 for " taking" ( read stealing) the IPOD speakers in my room - emailed back saying there were no IPOD speakers when I checked in and I don’t even own a IPOD. Hotel emailed back and apologized for the mistake - 15 mins later Amex call me to say that somebody at the hotel was trying to charge Euro 300 to my card and was this me. Obviously had checked out 2 days prior- Had to cancel my Amex card and needless to say I will never stay or recommend this hotel ever again. Amex currently investigaing for employee fraud Pity , I like the hotel and the location but obviously wont be staying again

Reviews.Title: “A perfect visit ...”
Reviews.Author: smore31
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at Mon Hotel. Arrived bleary eyed from New York at 8am, and were told our room wasnt ready til the afternoon. We looked sadly at them. We were cheerily told that they could put us in a slightly smaller room NOW, and we could move to a larger room the next day. We smiled gratefully. Then a minute later, while we still sat at the trendy little reception desk, we were told - well - go up and get some sleep, and later this afternoon while you are out we will move your things to your new room for you today. Magnifique! While smallish, the room was lovely, and the bed one of the most comfortable imaginable (king size!). Bathroom was lovely as well, with great toiletries provided, and FREE WIFI in the room that worked like a charm. On a quiet side street, about 5 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe, there is lovely little grocery shop open early til really late to get those juices or water or cookies or whatever you need., And several cafes nearby for coffee/crioissant in the morning at less than hotel prices. The Argentine Metro stop (Line 1) is 3 minuets away, and takes you directly to Champs Elysee, Louvre, Tuileries, Chatelet - and with one change to almost anywhere else you want to go. Cannot say enough good about the hotel and staff. (Now, OK, they DO play muzak in the halls of the bedroom floors. It turns off around midnight. But if you call they will immediately turn it off if the low murmur that seeps into your room bothers you).

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and a relatively good hotel”
Reviews.Author: yudesi
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week in an executive room. The hotel offered me upgrade to the executive room which was really nice and trendy. Overall the hotel is great with many innovative features and designs. However, it is about 10 mins walk from Champ Elysee and not suitable for those who want to experience the crowd and usual life in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very original”
Reviews.Author: tajmahal82
Reviews.Content: I was truly pleasantly surprised by this hotel, i went to this hotel not expecting much ( i am known for being a perfectionnist), I was blown away by the design of the place. I didn’t expect that kind of decor. We checked in ,the lady at the reception was very friendly like all the other members of the staff who were always helpful and smiling. I asked a staff member about the decoration and he kindly told me the hotel has been renovated a couple of months back. I was told that the hotel now had a restaurant and some new facilities including a massage service a spa and a fitness room. The room was quite spacious and was simply perfect according to my needs . The black colored ipod station fitted well into the general design. I would by the way like to congratulate the person who had this intresting idea. The bed was quite huge and very comfortable. And after a tiring day in the city of love i was able to get a peaceful sleep. The food at the restaurant was very tasty ( i just loved their salmon dish). Unfortunately i didn’t have the time to get a massage but the spa was very relaxing. As a conclusion i would like to say that given the situation of the hotel : it is one minute away from the Champs elysees by foot. And given it’s high standarts ( four stars) i enjoyed my stay I spent a great time in paris and the hotel was like the « icing on the cake ».

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back! The staff were so helpful and it's so close to the shops!!”
Reviews.Author: devongorg
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Friday and were really taken back by how close to the arc de triumph it was, literally right around the corner. It's in a really safe area and the hotel was lush. It''s stunning and modern art work and individual lighting really makes this place special. Rooms aren't enormous but are very comfortable, clean and private. The staff were so helpful, nothing was too much trouble, they booked meals - one of with was a a place called Trio (IIIO) the most amazing food i have ever eaten very small intimate place about £300 for 2 people but worth every penny- and taxis on our behalf and printed of a map to help me find the most exclusive shops. We had a meal and a couple of drinks, the food was lovely and the drinks were strong Fantastic! I will without a doubt return to this hotel as soon as i can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect New Year getaway”
Reviews.Author: beananddaisy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mon Hotel for New Year and it was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and unique and its location is perfectly central. Its just a short walk to the Arc de Triomphe and it is on main metro lines. We booked through lastminute.com but we contacted the hotel directly to seek advice regarding travel, events etc. The staff at Mon Hotel were extremely helpful both before and during the trip (the barman even downloaded information from the internet for us). The decor in the bar and reception is dark and decadent and the bedrooms are modern and plush. We loved the decor but I can imagine it wouldn't be everyone's cup of tea. We would return to Mon Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent bed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KeithStanhope
Reviews.Content: Booked Mon Hotel via LastMinute.com at very competitive rates. All was found as others have found it. It has its own character and charm, part boutique, part B&B in style, part three star and part five star. Very close to the metro, Argentine, and thus only one stop from Porte Maillot for shuttle to Paris Beauvais airport. No shortage of options for nearby eating and drinking. Also reasonably quiet, situated as it is in a side street. Warm welcome from well trained and helpful staff. Design led, quirky decor and furnishings will be liked by some and not by others. Our bedroom was small-ish but well enough equipped, the bed was super king sized and extremely comfortable and the en-suite good quality with decent shower above the small bath. The shiny bar cum restaurant was just fine for a glass of wine or a coffee. Other comments from reviewers about high prices are somewhat unfair - we found Paris generally extremely costly partially because of the forex rate but Mon Hotel's prices seemed consistent with those experienced elsewhere. All in all we were very pleased by our experience here and we would not hesitate in recommending Mon Hotel to friends. Service standards have been rightly praised by others, but a note on housekeeping standards - very thorough, with linen and towels changed daily!!

Reviews.Title: “Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martyn_Megan
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Paris and Hotel Mon is a charismatic and interesting hotel but for the money I expected a little more. Two weeks previously I stayed at a similar style hotel in Central London for a little less per night and standards and facilities were much better than Hotel Mon, indeed I wondered where they got their prices of 19 euros each for Breakfast, 5 euros for a can of Coke in the mini bar. Location is fantastic, Charles De Gaulle Etoile and Argentine Metro station are 2 minutes walk away as is the Arc de Triumphe, there's a nice bakery opposite Rue d'Argentine and a small grocers around the corner where you can stock up on water and other snacks. When you arrive at the hotel you step into a nicely furnished, modern Reception and I could not fault the staff, they were friendly and assisted in any way they could. We were on the third floor and stepping into the red leather clad creaky elevator was a little strange but not as strange as stepping into a narrow hall leading to our room that had dim lighting and darkish paint on the walls - it did feel a little like we had stepped into an arty horror movie. The room though was completely different, light, nice bathroom, huge comfy bed, flat screen TV but not much space, it did feel like they had crammed as much into the room as they could but with space in Paris hotels at a premium I was not too surprised and to be fair I was in Paris to not be in a hotel so was not bothered. All in all Hotel Mon had a lot going for it but we thought it a little too expensive for what it actually offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not so great decor”
Reviews.Author: jaspersmum
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at Mon Hotel at the start of November this year. What the hotel has going for it is it's location which is about a 3 minute walk from the Champs Elysee and only a minute from the Rue Grand Armie. A very nice area and one in which we felt secure walking around late at night. Hotel is only a minute from the metro.The hotel itself is like walking into a night club. It has very, very dark decor which is a shame as it makes it appear very small. The reception area is very nice and the staff are friendly and polite but it still felt a bit unwelcoming. Our room was lovely (though small) and the bathroom excellent due to it being light and airy with lovely marble fittings. The room decor was dark and although classy, it would have been so much nicer if it had been light and airy although that is just my own preference. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as it was €20 per person and a very good brekkie could be had around the corner from the hotel for half that price. On balance, I'd rate the hotel for the location and cleanliness but not for the decor which, as we were out all the time apart from sleeping, didn't make much difference. It would also have been nice if there had been tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We loved Paris and will return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!”
Reviews.Author: El_Fred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Mon Hotel for 2 nights, for my girlfriends' birthday. A perfect romantic stay. The design is wonderful, the location is incredible, from the corner of the street you can see the Arc de Triomphe (at 3 minutes walk). It is 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysées. The room are not huge but they are beautiful. Our bed was huge 2mx2m & incredibly comfortable. One of my best stays in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a Location!”
Reviews.Author: kiwimel01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel with a great location look no further. This was my 4th trip to Paris but Iw as taking my partner who had never been before. For us, this could not have been in a better spot as it was a hop skip and a jump to the Eiffel Tower and even clower to get to the Champs Elysee. On first impressions, I was a little hesitant about the decor as it was a little like something out of the lost boys film (very modern if not a little dark?). But once we were in our room it was PERFECT. Some of the reviews talk about how small the rooms are but to be perfectly honest, if you are spending a lot of time in your room when your on a trip to Paris there is something seriously wrong! All previous reviews about the beds are correct! They are the most AMAZING beds you have ever slept in and if I could have fitted it in my suitcase I would have dragged it back to London with me. Everything was clean and for the full 4 days that we were there the housekeeping service was prompt and effecient. The complimentary toiletries are a real treat too! One slight hiccup that we had was that the toilet was broken teh first tiem we flushed it - it constantly ran and never flushed again. We let the team downstairs know and everytime we arrived back after our excursions both the staff and ourselves thought it had been fixed. It wasnt too bad when you kept the lid closed and the bathroom door shut and we actually managed to sort things out in the sistene ourselves. The staff here were lovely. There is a particularly helpful gentleman - I'm gutted i forgot to ask his name, but he's tall and has dark hair and complexion. He was BRILLIANT! We didn't have breakfast at the hotel - there is a little bakery across the road, where we went every day for fresh croissants, pastries and freshly squeezed orange juice! Much more Parisian! Also teher is a supermarche just around the corner too, we got loads of staples for picnic lunches from there in the mornings. If you would like a recommendation for a decent local restaurant in the evening we went to Le Grand Armee, on the right, towards the Arc De Triomphe. We went there for our extra special anniversary dinner - if you like steak, it's the best I've had in my life! Not a cheap place to dine but for a extra special treat we took a venture on reccommendation from the staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my proposal trip...”
Reviews.Author: Larph
Reviews.Content: I was looking for somewhere in central Paris for our 3 night stay. Neither my fiancee or myself had been to Paris before, and I was a little nervous as this was the trip I was planning on proposing on - I wanted everything to run as smooth and hitch-free as possible. We found the hotel very easily, coming off of Eurostar and onto the metro. It is very close to Agentine metro station, and a stone's throw from Arc de Triumphe and Champs Elysee, not to mention a walkable distance to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine river. There are many great restaurants close to the hotel as well as a few cheaper places to stop for lunch and bakeries to grab some fresh breakfast goods - we couldn't hav efound a bette rplace for our budget, I am sure. The hotel itself is tucked away a little, but in a lovely neighbourhood and not too hard to find. It is quite small and 'confined' but for central Paris it's more than adequate. The room was small, but again the bed was lovely, bathroom was modern, all very clean and lots of nice little modern extras like free wifi, large flat screen tv and ipod dock. We loved it and would be more than happy to stay again. Oh, did I mention how helpful the staff were? (Not to mention totally fluent in English).

Reviews.Title: “The Mon Hotel is chilled, trendy and fab”
Reviews.Author: LondonNat2008
Reviews.Content: Fantastic, modern, funky hotel, right off the Champs Elysees, by the Arc de Triompe - couldnt be closer. Metro station just at the end of the road. The rooms are quite small but have everything you need and unless your planning a lot of time in there, more than fine for Paris. The double bed was huge and very comfortable. Room had an i-pod dock which was great to listen to our own music while we were there. The decor of the hotel is fab, the reception areas were beautiful and always smelled gorgeous! The Reception staff were really friendly and helpful (especially Francis!) and recommended some great bars and restaurants. The only downside was that our shower head was broken and didnt stay on the holder but the room was so comfortable we didnt bother asking to move. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sbarrow
Reviews.Content: Booked via Eurostar so got an ok rate for Paris But this hotel was just very average. Very small room but comfortable bed. Annoying music in the public rooms eventually turned off at 10 pm but if you wanted a nap in your room in the afternoon......... The good news is Parius has too much to offer for that. Bathroom ok although again quite pokey. Standard fare on the bathroom products, no robes. TV advertises 900 channels, but only a couple of English channels worked. No DVD player, but curiously an ipod docking station. I gave up on the wifi and went to a cafe. No instructions etc in the room and no wired internet alternative despite advertising it was available. As other reviewers have said, but sadly I ignored, go elsewhere for brekfast. 15 Euro gets you orange juice, coco pops or corn flakes and baguettes with jam or processed cheese. The reception is pretty cool, but it takes more than that to run a boutique hotel. Perhaps it was better just after the refurb. I have enjoyed better in Paris and for a cheap hotel why not save some money and stay in a TimHotel ? If it is a special occaision, try somewhere more authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh La La!”
Reviews.Author: Twinklefax
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days in May. We booked it after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. It is a small friendly hotel which is ideal for a short stay in Paris. The rooms are small, decorated with a contemparary feel and are very clean. We loved the complementary toiletries & magazines and the tiny Parisian balcony was adorable. The major problem for us was the lack of tea/coffee facilities; none in the rooms and unavailable elsewhere in the hotel except for breakfast time. The public areas were again nicely decorated apart from the dark austere corridors. The breakfast room was a bit of a let down; a tiny basement room with minimal seating, however if you like continental type breakfasts the food is okay. The staff seemed friendly enough, but not all of them spoke English; we didn't see this as a problem though, as it gave us chance to practise our limited French! The main problem with the hotel was the absence of a bar, we were led to believe on the website that we booked the hotel through, that the bar would be complete for the end of March 2008; however this was not the case and there was no evidence of a bar being completed in the near future. This said, there were bars/bistros in the vicinity of the hotel. The location is great, near to Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees, with a Metro station 2 mins walking distance away. The Hotel is tucked away in a quiet street, so the only noise is from the dustbin men (who are noisy!). We would definately stay here again despite it being a little overpriced, however given a choice we would probably stay on the left bank; Latin Quarter, St Germain areas, as there is a better nightime atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “It's great mon”
Reviews.Author: jim1664
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel close to the Arc de Triomph. We asked for a room with a view prior to arrival and were given an executive room on the top floor at the front of the hotel - the penthouse if you like. The room wasgreat, if a little small even for a few days - it was decorated in a contemporary style but not pretencious. The walls were leather/ suede lined though if that counts! Just a nice room - none of the extras such as room service, bar etc but do you need them during a long weekend?

HotelInfo.Name: Mon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1/5 rue d'Argentine, 75116 Paris, France
